intro: As an open-source project, the LDP4j community has many entry points. We welcome your participation however it suits your level of interest.

sections.title: Issue Tracker
paragraphs: The project tracks bugs, feature-requests, and other issues through the issue-tracking facilities provided by GitHub.

sections.title: Source Repository
paragraphs: All the LDP4j source code is managed using the distributed version system Git and hosted in the ldp4j repository of the ldp4j organization at github.com. Both Git and GitHub are awesome for collaboration! To make improvements or bug fixes to the LDP4j project, simply fork the project, commit your changes and send a pull request.

sections.title: Twitter
paragraphs: The project is also on Twitter. Follow our @ldp4j feed. Here we'll let you now about our latest achievements, releases, and more!

sections.title: Mailing Lists
paragraphs: We've set up different mailing lists in Google Groups to foster discussion in the community: LDP4j Users, a mailing list to hosts discussions for developers using LDP4j in their projects; LDP4j Development, a mailing list reserved for discussions about contributing to LDP4j; and LDP4j Commits, a mailing list for tracking the updates to the source repository.

sections.title: Contact
paragraphs: If you want to talk to us directly just email us at our official contact address:
